Author: mossalto
Text: It's tough, but try not to focus on your schoolwork too much. You can get extensions on homework, you can delay tests, you can resit your GCSEs. You don't get a do-over on your health. Focus on getting yourself better first.

Author: snefferu
Text: Disbelief and denial are completely normal and part of the recovery process. I was diagnosed 25 years ago and still struggle with these thoughts, and itâ€™s still very scary. Try to trust those who love you to help you get through this and let them support you. It may take some time to sink in, but you will realise that the delusions from anorexia can be profound and when it gets severe (which is sounds like it already is) you cannot deal with it alone. Very best wishes
